description: Knee-high lock-boot waders in near-black waxed leather

core:description.text: Knee-high waders of heavily waxed leather, nearly black from repeated treatments of tallow and pitch. The boots rise to just below the knee, secured by brass buckles that lock tight against the calf to keep water out when wading in shallows. The soles are thick and scored for grip on slick surfaces, and the whole construction speaks of a craft developed over generations of river work.
